title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Thomas Jr. totaled over 1,200 receiving yards in his rookie season with the Jacksonville Jaguars in 2024.
New England Patriots may consider trading for Thomas to enhance their offense after a flat post-season performance.
Thomas' regression in 2025 opens possibility for trade; Patriots could offer significant draft picks and assets.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored in overtime, giving Team USA a 2-1 win over Sweden in the Olympic men's hockey quarterfinals.
Charlie McAvoy's physical play was key, as he delivered multiple hits and supported Team USA's defense in the win.
Four Bruins players remain in the semifinals; USA's McAvoy and Swayman, and Finland's Jokiharju and Korpisalo.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield holds Massachusetts' largest ICE contract, securing $5.2 million for BearCat armored vehicles.
Governor Maura Healey criticized local companies contracting with ICE, but Lenco's contracts have avoided intense scrutiny.
Lenco received state grants to boost production and turned down a $10 million ICE contract, focusing on other clientele.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman, former Massachusetts State Police union head, sentenced to two years for racketeering, fraud, tax crimes.
Anne Lynch, former union lobbyist, received 15 months for fraud, obstruction of justice, and tax crimes.
Pullman and Lynch ordered to pay over $85,000 in restitution for misuse of union funds and tax evasion.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz will leave his chief meteorologist role at Boston 25 News on February 27 after nearly 30 years.
Lemanowicz has been with Boston 25 since its inception in 1996, covering major weather events in New England.
Boston 25 VP Todd Brown praised Lemanowicz's commitment to excellence and connection with the community.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The 2026 Red Sox home jerseys faced criticism for overlapping stripes and lettering, prompting a design update.
Red Sox stated the jerseys will be updated with improved spacing by Opening Day, collaborating with MLB and Fanatics.
The team confirmed that the original jersey design was their choice, thanking Fanatics for their cooperation.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Pawtucket police found firearms, ammunition, and gun accessories in Robert Dorgan's storage locker in Brunswick, Maine.
Robert Dorgan was identified as the shooter in the fatal attack at Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, R.I.
Police commended several bystanders who intervened to subdue the shooter and provide first aid to victims.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA announces Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines will see weekend service suspensions in March for upgrades.
Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills suspended Feb. 28 - March 8; free shuttles provided.
Commuter Rail suspensions impact Fitchburg, Haverhill, Lowell, Newburyport/Rockport lines; shuttle services available.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers dismissed comments from Red Sox chairman Tom Werner about his reluctance to play first base.
Devers, traded to the Giants in June 2025, responded by saying he wants to leave the past behind.
The Red Sox moved Devers from third base to DH following Alex Bregman's signing, leading to tensions.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Adam Schefter reports any team, including the Patriots, must offer a 'Micah Parsons-type package' for Maxx Crosby.
Crosby's potential trade stems from dissatisfaction with the Raiders, linked to communication issues over a December injury.
The Patriots, struggling with a low sack count, could consider trading their 2026 first-round pick for Crosby.
